name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets
description: Overwatch is the beginning of some surprising connections in this Constellation that explores videogame movies, cartoons, and music docos and shows.

key_work.title: VFX in Overwatch
key_work.brief_description: A look at the use of VFX in Blizzard Entertainment’s hit videogame Overwatch.

end.title: Warcraft
end.creator_credit: Chris Metzen, Alex Gartner, Charles Roven, Jon Jashni, Tessa Ross and Thomas Tull
end.headline_credit: Canada, China, Japan and United States of America, 2016

video_links.name: Warcraft: The Beginning – Official Movie Trailer (Universal Pictures)

end.brief_description: The realm of Azeroth stands on the brink of war as its civilization faces a fearsome race of invading orcs fleeing their dying home to colonize another. As a portal opens to connect the two worlds, one army faces destruction and the other faces extinction.

constellations_other.name: Mayes C Rubeo
constellations_other.description: Emmy-award winning and Oscar-nominated costume designer Mayes C Rubeo has worked on some of Hollywood's biggest blockbusters, designing costumes for characters and creatures across time, space and everything in between.

constellations_other.name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets
constellations_other.description: Overwatch is the beginning of some surprising connections in this Constellation that explores videogame movies, cartoons, and music docos and shows.

links.description: Overwatch was the creation of long-standing international videogame developer Blizzard Entertainment, who are also known for the hugely successful Warcraft series, which was adapted into a feature film in 2016.

end.title: Moon
end.creator_credit: Alex Francis, Deepak Sikka, Justin Lanchbury, Mark Foligno, Nicky Bentham, Steve Milne, Stuart Fenegan and Trudie Styler
end.brief_description: Sam Bell is getting anxious to finally return to Earth. He is the only occupant of a Moon-based manufacturing facility along with his computer and assistant, GERTY. When he has an accident however, he wakens to find that he is not alone.

constellations_other.name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets
constellations_other.description: Overwatch is the beginning of some surprising connections in this Constellation that explores videogame movies, cartoons, and music docos and shows.

links.description: Warcraft was thought to be the film that could break the videogame-to-movie curse, but unfortunately it was poorly received and barely scraped back its budget. It was directed by Duncan Jones, who became beloved by sci-fi fans for Moon.

start.title: Moon

start.brief_description: Sam Bell is getting anxious to finally return to Earth. He is the only occupant of a Moon-based manufacturing facility along with his computer and assistant, GERTY. When he has an accident however, he wakens to find that he is not alone.

end.title: Labyrinth
end.creator_credit: Eric Rattray, Henson Organisation, Lucasfilm Ltd. and Elliot Scott
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1986
end.brief_description: When teen Sarah is forced to babysit Toby, her baby stepbrother, she summons Jareth the Goblin King to take him away. When he is actually kidnapped, Sarah is given just thirteen hours to solve a labyrinth and rescue him.

constellations_other.name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets
constellations_other.description: Overwatch is the beginning of some surprising connections in this Constellation that explores videogame movies, cartoons, and music docos and shows.

constellations_other.name: Webwurlds
constellations_other.description: Jess Johnson and Simon Ward's work is inspired by science fiction and fantasy. Johnson's hand-drawn illustrations are heavily detailed with geometric patterns and incorporate anthropomorphic characters amongst architectural environments in immersive other worlds.

links.description: Moonwas the directorial debut of Jones, who was born Zowie and later changed his name. He was the son of Angie and David Bowie, the latter who famously played the Goblin King in Labyrinth.

start.title: Labyrinth
start.creator_credit: Eric Rattray, Henson Organisation, Lucasfilm Ltd. and Elliot Scott
start.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1986
start.brief_description: When teen Sarah is forced to babysit Toby, her baby stepbrother, she summons Jareth the Goblin King to take him away. When he is actually kidnapped, Sarah is given just thirteen hours to solve a labyrinth and rescue him.

end.title: Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders From Mars
end.brief_description: A decadent show, a hallucinogenic collage of kitsch, pop irony and flamboyant excess: a musical symbiosis of feminine passion and masculine dominance that defines Bowie’s art and the glam rock genre.

constellations_other.name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets
constellations_other.description: Overwatch is the beginning of some surprising connections in this Constellation that explores videogame movies, cartoons, and music docos and shows.

links.description: Labyrinth is one of Bowie’s most enduring acting roles, but as a musician he was groundbreaking for his use of moving image to create characters and enhance his storytelling, highlighted in the documentary concert film Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders From Mars.

start.title: Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders From Mars
start.brief_description: A decadent show, a hallucinogenic collage of kitsch, pop irony and flamboyant excess: a musical symbiosis of feminine passion and masculine dominance that defines Bowie’s art and the glam rock genre.

end.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
end.brief_description: Deep down in the Pacific Ocean in the subterranean city of Bikini Bottom lives a square yellow sponge named SpongeBob SquarePants.

constellations_other.name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets
constellations_other.description: Overwatch is the beginning of some surprising connections in this Constellation that explores videogame movies, cartoons, and music docos and shows.

links.description: A lover of storytelling in all its forms, Bowie was just as comfortable in Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders From Mars as he was voicing the character of Lord Royal Highness in SpongeBob SquarePants.

start.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
start.brief_description: Deep down in the Pacific Ocean in the subterranean city of Bikini Bottom lives a square yellow sponge named SpongeBob SquarePants.

constellations_other.name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets

end.title: Rugrats
end.creator_credit: Bee Beckman, Cella Nichols Duffy, Charles Swenson, David Blum, Eryk Casemiro, Geraldine Clarke, Jim Duffy, Kate Boutilier, Kathrin Seitz, Margot Pipkin, Mary Harrington, Maureen Iser, Monica Piper, Paul Demeyer, Paul Germain, Pernelle Hayes, Rick Gitelson, Sherry Gunther, Susan Ward and Klasky-Csupo
end.brief_description: Rugrats focuses on a group of toddlers and their day-to-day lives, usually involving common life experiences that become adventures in the babies’ imaginations.

constellations_other.name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets
constellations_other.description: Overwatch is the beginning of some surprising connections in this Constellation that explores videogame movies, cartoons, and music docos and shows.

links.description: SpongeBob SquarePants was just one of the animated phenomenons developed by the creative duo of Merriwether Williams and Kate Boutilier. The Emmy Award-winners were responsible for decades worth of childhood favourites, including Rugrats.

start.title: Rugrats
start.creator_credit: Bee Beckman, Cella Nichols Duffy, Charles Swenson, David Blum, Eryk Casemiro, Geraldine Clarke, Jim Duffy, Kate Boutilier, Kathrin Seitz, Margot Pipkin, Mary Harrington, Maureen Iser, Monica Piper, Paul Demeyer, Paul Germain, Pernelle Hayes, Rick Gitelson, Sherry Gunther, Susan Ward and Klasky-Csupo
start.brief_description: Rugrats focuses on a group of toddlers and their day-to-day lives, usually involving common life experiences that become adventures in the babies’ imaginations.

end.title: A Different World
end.creator_credit: Debbie Allen, Tom Werner and Bill Cosby
end.brief_description: A Different World is a spin-off series from The Cosby Show centred on Denise Huxtable and students at Hillman College, a fictional mixed but historically black college in the state of Virginia.

constellations_other.name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets
constellations_other.description: Overwatch is the beginning of some surprising connections in this Constellation that explores videogame movies, cartoons, and music docos and shows.

links.description: Cree Summer voiced the Rugrats character Susie in both the series and the movies. One of the most prolific voice actors of her generation and few women of colour working in the industry, she had her live-action breakout with A Different World.

start.title: A Different World
start.creator_credit: Debbie Allen, Tom Werner and Bill Cosby
start.brief_description: A Different World is a spin-off series from The Cosby Show centred on Denise Huxtable and students at Hillman College, a fictional mixed but historically black college in the state of Virginia.

end.title: High Fidelity
end.creator_credit: D.V. DeVincentis, John Cusack, Steve Pink, Laura Bauer, Rudd Simmons and Tim Bevan
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2000
end.brief_description: When record store owner Rob Gordon gets dumped by his girlfriend, Laura, because he hasn’t changed since they met, he revisits his top five breakups of all time in an attempt to figure out what went wrong.

constellations_other.name: Film and TV dreams
constellations_other.description: Fleetwood Mac's 'Dreams' coasted its way back up the charts 40 years after it was first released, thanks to Nathan Apodaca's joyous viral TikTok, but Fleetwood Mac (and Stevie Knicks) have been main staples of screen culture for decades.

constellations_other.name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets
constellations_other.description: Overwatch is the beginning of some surprising connections in this Constellation that explores videogame movies, cartoons, and music docos and shows.

links.description: As Denise Huxtable, Lisa Bonet was the star of Cosby Show spin-off A Different World and would have an eclectic movie career, including in Stephen Frears’ High Fidelity. Twenty years later, her daughter Zoe Kravitz would star in a TV version of High Fidelity.
